articles.description: Europe's Ludvig Aberg is thrust straight into Ryder Cup action by being paired with Viktor Hovland in Friday's opening session against the United States.
articles.title: Europe and US reveal opening Ryder Cup pairings

articles.description: Surrey retain the County Championship title after rivals Essex fail to get any batting points against Northamptonshire.
articles.title: Surrey retain County Championship title

articles.description: Liverpool owners FSG agree to sell a minority take in the club worth around £82m-£164m to Dynasty Equity.
articles.title: FSG agree to sell minority stake in Liverpool

articles.description: Two years after being thrashed by the US at Whistling Straits a new-look Europe have their opportunity for redemption in Rome in the 44th Ryder Cup.
articles.title: Europe's chance of Ryder Cup redemption against US

articles.description: BBC Sport speaks to Darius Vassell, Tom Cleverley and Jermain Defoe about a course designed to make them into future football coaches and managers.
articles.title: How Southgate's early struggles shape future managers

articles.description: It is 30 years since the United States last won a Ryder Cup contest in Europe. As the two sides face each other in Rome, BBC Sport looks back at Europe's dominance over their past six home meetings.
articles.title: Relive Europe's Ryder Cup home dominance

articles.description: Jersey Reds players could be left "stranded" on the island after the Championship club ceases trading.
articles.title: Jersey players could be 'stranded' as club folds

articles.description: Hamish Watson, Luke Crosbie, Ben Healy and Javan Sebastian are among those starting the World Cup match against Romania, with Grant Gilchrist captaining the side.
articles.title: Scotland change 13 for meeting with Romania

articles.description: The absence of terrestrial television coverage for England women's Test series against Canada is "damaging", according to full-back Ellie Kildunne.
articles.title: Lack of TV coverage for England women ‘damaging’

articles.description: New Zealand-based Rodin Cars says its application to enter Formula 1 with a female driver has been rejected by the sport's governing body.
articles.title: FIA rejects Rodin Cars bid to join F1 grid
